uk.ac.qmul.sbcs.evolution.convergence.handlers.documents.parsers.codeml

Class CodemlAncestralSiteOutputParser.BranchLineage

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.qmul.sbcs.evolution.convergence.handlers.documents.parsers.codeml.CodemlAncestralSiteOutputParser.BranchLineage
  • Enclosing class:
    CodemlAncestralSiteOutputParser

    public class CodemlAncestralSiteOutputParser.BranchLineage
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class to determine whether an ArrayList contains a continuous path/lineage from tip A <=> tip B.

    NOTE that internal lineage representation implemented in HashSet; thus, duplicate branches can exist

    NOTE that there is no mechanism at the moment to define nodes as tips only. This means internal node UIDs could be used. This would be a bad idea, as chains could extend towards terminal tips without ever joining!

    Author:
    Joe Parker, Kitson Consulting / Queen Mary University of London

        public BranchLineage(int A,
                     int B)
        Constructor for BranchLineage - args are tip UIDs for destination points, and the CodemlAncestralSiteOutputParser.Branches that contain them.

        NOTE that internal lineage representation implemented in HashSet; thus, duplicate branches can exist

        Parameters:
        A - - UID for node number at one tip of the lineage
        B - - UID for node number at the other tip of the lineage

    • Method Detail

      • getCompleteLineage

        public java.util.HashSet<CodemlAncestralSiteOutputParser.Branch> getCompleteLineage()
                                                                             throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns the HashSet of all CodemlAncestralSiteOutputParser.Branches that connect this lineage, if it is complete. Tests whether adjoins is already true, or attempts to complete from branch pool if it isn't before giving up and throwing a NullPointerException if the lineage can't be completed from the branch pool.
        Returns:
        HashSet of the branches comprising this lineage.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the lineage can't be completed from the two chains (A and B) and the current branch pool.

      • addBranch

        public boolean addBranch(CodemlAncestralSiteOutputParser.Branch newBranch)
        Adds a branch to the internal branches ArrayList
        Parameters:
        newBranch - - branch to be added to lineage.

      • doesLineageAdjoin

        public boolean doesLineageAdjoin()
        Evaluates whether the ArrayList branches describes a continuous lineage from A to B; returns true if so; all other values false.

        Pseudocode: 

         extent_A = tip_A
 extent_B = tip_B
 chain_A
 chain_B
 exhausted = false #this will set to true if we ever iterate through all available branches without a hit
 while(!exhausted){
        extended_this_round = false
        for(branch:branches){
                if(branch.contains(extent_A){
                        extent_A = branch.tip.not_extent_A
                        chain_A.add(branch)
                        extended_this_round = true
                }
                if(branch.contains(extent_B){... as for A...}
                if(branch.contains(extent_A && extent_B){
                        #this is the final branch, lineage is complete
                        adjoins = true; extended_this_round = true
                }
        }
        exhausted = !extended_this_round
 }
        Returns:
        true if branches describe a path from A to B; otherwise false
